programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe takes on a group of conservationists who are opposed to the building of a new motorway link. Culinary drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.desc: Part two of two. While in Venice investigating his friend's death, Lovejoy discovers that not only is the beautiful Caterina saving art for herself rather than posterity, but so too is her sister Lavinia. Fulton Mackay, Gwen Humble and Haydn Gwynne guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac rushes in a mystery patient, whose arrival sets in motion in a deepening medical crisis that could have serious repercussions for her secret relationship with Kian. Cameron basks in the glory of being declared a hero - prompting Nicky to issue him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A woman who has been raped and beaten and her young son, who has also been sexually abused, are rushed into Holby

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's the day of Boyden's funeral, but it soon becomes clear how unpopular he was when very few colleagues contribute to his collection, and it takes the arrival of retired sergeant Bob Cryer to remind them where their loyalties should lie. Meanwhile, Aussie copper Cameron is drafted in to infiltrate a shoplifting ring run by a fellow countryman, and CID goes in search of suspected gunman Prince, who has made a dramatic escape from custody. But when Brandon catches up with the desperate felon, he finds himself staring down the wrong end of a gun. Daniel Macpherson stars, with a guest appearance by Neighbours actor Stefan Dennis

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Paul battles with himself to do the right thing. Natalie quizzes Janine in front of Barry. Meanwhile, can Dot find peace?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian undercuts Laura's prices and wins a catering contract. Alfie is delighted when a familiar face returns to the Square

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: The sudden death of a companion causes complications for the women, whose problems are further compounded by a tea dance at the Raffles Hotel and an impending visit to Changi. Second World War drama, starring Stephanie Cole and Cindy Shelley

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A firearms expert agrees to repair a valuable antique gun on Lovejoy's behalf, but unfortunately for all concerned, it is later used in a robbery. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Sam gets emotionally involved in the heart-rending case of a pregnant cancer sufferer who refuses to endanger her unborn child by undergoing treatment. On a happier note, Andrew and Joanna's campaign to save the local community hospital gets a boost as an unlikely benefactor steps in to make sure their fund-raising barn dance goes with a swing. Starring Joseph Millson, Gary Mavers and Haydn Gwynne

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec's over-apologetic attitude after Zoe's miscarriage puts their relationship under pressure

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince convinces Penny that a holiday in Portugal will be their parting gesture. Romantic comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Tom attempts to step into his father's shoes by riding Compo's bicycle and, enthused by Clegg and Truly's anecdotes, he sets about performing wonders of his own on the two-wheeled bone-shaker. Meanwhile, Pearl is delighted when Howard gets stuck on the roof, enabling her to keep an eye on him, and Glenda is dismayed to learn Barry has challenged a member of the office staff to a duel - refereed by Billy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and Truly fail to bring a smile to the face of Billy's humourless brother-in-law Bradley, until Auntie Wainwright passes by with an inflatable animal feeding trough. Peter Sallis stars

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Mallory and Father Brown go missing, and it is up to the gang to save them from a man hell-bent on revenge. Mark Williams and Jack Deam star in the crime drama

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: A sighting of the mysteriously missing Baron Battenberg sends the press and police into a frenzy. Sam and Ruth go undercover

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam and Harry investigate when a gruesome, partly mummified corpse is found after a lorry crashes into an old factory building. The forensic experts attempt to identify the remains by reconstructing the skull, while DCI Telford and DS Linden track down a woman who claims the body is that of a former boyfriend who disappeared seven years previously. It soon transpires that the deceased had unsavoury connections. Benedict Cumberbatch makes an early screen appearance, alongside stars Amanda Burton, William Gaminara and Tom Ward

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: A ruthless campaign of executions is carried out, but the deaths have the unintended result of building public support for the defeated rebels. As prisoners are shipped to England, May is persecuted by the authorities, while Frances is driven to take drastic action

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jac rushes in a mystery patient, whose arrival sets in motion in a deepening medical crisis that could have serious repercussions for her secret relationship with Kian. Keller is shocked when a new member of staff reveals the truth about Sacha's deception, and is tempted to take out his anguish on a vulnerable patient. Cameron basks in the glory of being declared a hero - prompting Nicky to issue him with an ultimatum

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: The first in a series of short monologues originally broadcast in response to the 50th anniversary of the decriminalisation of homosexuality. A young man returning from the trenches of the First World War recollects a love that he dare not speak about. Starring Ben Whishaw and written and directed by Mark Gatiss

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: The past comes back to haunt Wilf when a former German soldier turns up in the village with news of his brother. Arthur creates havoc in hospital after spraining his ankle, and an artist sets hearts fluttering among the women of Ormston. Drama, starring James Bolam, Michael French and John Henshaw

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Wilf and Arthur get in a flap with a rum-drinking parrot, and the big day arrives in Ormston - but the groom may not be all he seems. Tom offers to help with the wedding arrangements, but his time is eaten up when a farmer hurts his arm in a threshing machine, leading the farm labourers to strike for improved working conditions

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: The team are called in to investigate the death of a man who'd been living a hermit-like existence for years, although Dangerous soon deduces he can't have been living alone. The post mortem confirms he was killed, but the case soon takes a horrifying turn when a search of the victim's home reveals an old movie showing a child's murder. Meanwhile, Mod's new job as a children's entertainer leads to an unexpected meeting with a potential love interest. Jeff Rawle, Celia Imrie and Hywel Bennett guest star

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: When comedian Bunny Hopper (guest star Roy Hudd) collapses and dies on stage, a heart attack seems the probable cause. However, the post-mortem reveals that he had ingested rat poison. Not only was Bunny married, but he had a long list of female friends all over the country with three regular girlfriends in Willesden alone - all of whom were at the club the night he died. With most of the squad away on a special assignment, Dangerous and Mod start interviewing all of the suspects. Drama, starring Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe has cause to regret getting involved in an elderly cookery writer's family affairs, and a series of squabbles among the staff only add to his woes. Comedy drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Fisher ropes Crabbe into helping investigate the death of a policewoman in the West Country, a task that almost puts him off his food. Detective drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is ordered to track down two OAP fraudsters - but he seems more interested in getting his hands on their recipe for bread-and-butter pudding. Being lumbered with a temporary partner only complicates matters for the cuisine-loving policeman, and leads to friction with Cambridge. Guest starring Joan Sims, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A woman's body is found on the moors, and although it looks like suicide, Gently is convinced it is suspicious - even after finding out the victim had mood swings and suffered from motor neurone disease. She was a GP, estranged from her husband, and it isn't long before he is in the frame, although as the investigation moves to the doctor's home community - the same place where Rachel grew up - a secretive local company provides a new lead. Meanwhile, Bacchus celebrates his promotion, leaving Gently needing a new sergeant. Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and Lisa McGrillis star, with Lesley Nicol (Downton Abbey) and Jason Done (Waterloo Road)

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Jared discovers a severed human hand in a crayfish pot, begging the questions who does it belong to and are they still alive? Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man suspected of killing a police officer is seen near Kembleford and Mallory is determined to catch him, but he has to ask the sleuthing priest for help when disaster strikes

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: Historical drama exploring the events that led to the Easter Rising in 1916, from the point of view of a group of friends living in Dublin, Belfast and London. The outbreak of the First World War has an overwhelming impact on Ireland, and as it becomes clear that the campaign will last for many years, social stability is eroded and nationalism comes to the fore

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A man arrives in an East Anglian village with his sister Joanna to convalesce following a flying accident - but the residents' warm welcome isn't all it seems. Joan Hickson stars as the elderly sleuth, with Andrew Bicknell and Sabina Franklyn

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: An asylum seeker is murdered on a notorious Edinburgh housing estate in what appears to be a race-hate crime - but Rebus suspects there is something more complex behind it. A local MP also reports a missing Kosovan girl, who was last seen in a car with a known criminal - and it turns out he has vanished as well. Ken Stott stars as Ian Rankin's jaded detective, with Claire Price and Cora Bissett

programme.title: Small Island
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jamaican woman travels to London in 1948 to join her new husband, but her life becomes entwined with that of her landlady, who once spent a night of passion with the young bride's former love. Adaptation of Andrea Levy's novel, starring Naomie Harris, Ruth Wilson, David Oyelowo, Ashley Walters and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: It is 1994 and as Parliament votes on lowering the age of male homosexual consent, 17-year-old Andrew arrives in London for the first time - with unexpected results. Monologue by Michael Dennis, starring Fionn Whitehead

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A girl's disappearance prompts the team to call in retired sergeant Bob Cryer, who knows the suspects better than anyone - but his services are soon dispensed with when it becomes clear his old-school methods aren't suited to modern policing. Undeterred, the veteran plod teams up with his niece, Sun Hill's front desk officer Robbie, to finish the job. Meanwhile, PC Gemma Osbourne ponders her future at the station following her attack, and drug-addled PC Nick Klein's fellow coppers raid the house where he is taking his first dose of crack, with the help of Sgt Boyden's daughter Amy

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: With a five-year-old girl in hospital having accidentally ingested crack cocaine, the search is on to find her mother - and it's not long before Sgt Matt Boyden realises the missing woman is none other than his own tearaway daughter Amy. But the case takes on a different dimension for PC Gary Best when he discovers that colleague PC Nick Klein was also in the taxi that dropped the little girl off. Back at the station, a thief is at large and new boy PC Cameron Tait is in the frame, while Acting DI Sam Nixon faces facts when her trouble-making teenage daughter is brought in for being drunk and disorderly

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Nick Klein goes in search of his next fix of crack cocaine, only to fall into a trap set by PC Jim Carver which results in his arrest. Meanwhile, Sgt Matt Boyden decides to help Abi Nixon find her father - despite the trouble the teenage temptress put him through just a few short weeks ago - and the locker room is put under surveillance in a bid to catch the station thief, with the finger of suspicion still pointing squarely at Aussie PC Cameron Tait

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's an eventful day for Matt Boyden. Having discovered the identity of Abi's father, he confronts the girl's mother, his hated colleague Acting DI Sam Nixon, threatening to tell the tearaway teen everything he knows. Then he gets a blast from the past when his own estranged, crack-addicted daughter Amy is found and brought in for questioning. But it soon becomes clear none of these loose ends will ever be tied when the dodgy sergeant answers a seemingly routine callout to a suspect package - only to fall victim to a drive-by shooting. But who pulled the trigger - and why?

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: It's the day of Boyden's funeral, but it soon becomes clear how unpopular he was when very few colleagues contribute to his collection, and it takes the arrival of retired sergeant Bob Cryer to remind them where their loyalties should lie. Meanwhile, Aussie copper Cameron is drafted in to infiltrate a shoplifting ring run by a fellow countryman, and CID goes in search of suspected gunman Prince, who has made a dramatic escape from custody. But when Brandon catches up with the desperate felon, he finds himself staring down the wrong end of a gun. Daniel Macpherson stars, with a guest appearance by Neighbours actor Stefan Dennis

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Change is on the way to the sleepy market town of Cranford as the railway pushes out from Manchester, but many of the female residents are more excited about the arrival of the handsome new doctor, Frank Harrison. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. Dr Harrison's plans to become better acquainted with Sophy are thwarted by Caroline Tomkinson and Clara Smith, Mr Carter takes pity on an illiterate 10-year-old and Miss Matty is shaken to see a face from her past. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Eileen Atkins

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in the town, but Lady Ludlow regrets any notion of seasonal charity when Mr Carter asks her to intervene in the case of Job Gregson, who has been blamed for a spate of thefts. Miss Matty is delighted when Mr Holbrook invites her to his farm, and Dr Harrison's friend Jack sends Caroline Tomkinson a card hinting she should expect a proposal from the medic. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Philip Glenister

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Rag Nymph
programme.desc: Feature-length period melodrama set in Victorian times, charting the relationship between feisty Newcastle rag-woman Aggie Winkowski and 10-year-old orphan Millie Forester. Determined to protect Millie from the seamy world of prostitution, Aggie resolves to take the youngster under her wing. Starring Honeysuckle Weeks, Perdita Weeks, Val McLane, Alec Newman, Crispin Bonham-Carter and Patrick Ryecart

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: A sighting of the mysteriously missing Baron Battenberg sends the press and police into a frenzy. Sam and Ruth go undercover

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A former sex kitten tells a tabloid newspaper all about her promiscuous past, much to the disgust of villagers, and later suffers a tragic accident that leaves her in a coma. Shortly after, she is spotted making her way to church, remorseful and ready to seek forgiveness for her sins. Jonathan and Maddy are baffled but not convinced that her recovery has a supernatural explanation. Emma Kennedy guest stars

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The duo investigate the case of a murdered drug-runner who seems to have returned from the dead to exact vengeance on his killers using the power of voodoo. Offbeat drama, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin and Stuart Milligan, with a guest appearance by Jonathan Ross

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler and Miles continue their efforts to track down the killer, who is using the legacy of the Kray twins to invoke fear and paranoia on the streets of Whitechapel. When the threats become personal, the detectives begin to wonder just how far the murderer's power reaches. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Chandler, Miles and the team are forced to play the Kray twins at their own game, with the body count rising and no tangible evidence against the pair. As time begins to run out, the detectives go underground in the hope of bringing those responsible for the killings to justice. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: A twisted fetishist is murdering women in a horrific echo of an unsolved case from the 1980s. Luther is keen that he and his team concentrate all their resources into catching the copycat before he or she strikes again, only for his focus to be divided by a second case involving a malicious internet tormentor found dead in his home. Pulled in every direction, the cop's patience begins to wear thin, so the last thing he needs is to deal with a road accident - until he sets eyes on one of the women involved. Is he finally on the verge of finding love? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba, cwith Warren Brown, Sienna Guillory, Nikki Amuka-Bird and Dermot Crowley

programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes documentary looking at how the Argentina star, won the World Cup for the first time in his illustrious career last year in Qatar. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig follows in the footsteps of Charles Dickens as she explores the Kent countryside, visiting the setting of Great Expectations and the house where the author died

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development potential of a Warwickshire property above a former brewery, a Staffordshire house with a huge back garden and a former farm building in Nottinghamshire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from the Kent County Showground in Detling, and finds out about local explorer Julius Brenchley. With experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley celebrates the 25th anniversary of the Angel of the North, joined by the statue's creator Antony Gormley and the former Bishop of Jarrow

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann, British gymnastics great Beth Tweddle, seven-time snooker world champion Stephen Hendry and BBC sports presenter JJ Chalmers join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the last leg of his railway journey around the north-west coast of England, visiting the childhood home of William Wordsworth in Cockermouth, Cumbria, and ending in Maryport, where the Solway Firth marks the border between England and Scotland

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Riya and Nanda have a sad and unloved garden in Groby, Leicestershire, with an outdated pink and yellow 'Battenburg' patio, a tumble down shed and a huge gravel slope. This really is a plot that needs to be rescued, especially as Riya is soon to be married and they are hoping to host some of the celebrations in the garden. Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam offer expert advice, which involves picking up on the reds and golds of Riya's wedding colours in the planting

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards head to north London to help grandmother Maura make over her messy lounge. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they build a birdwatching area for her grandchildren, fix the unsafe stairs and give the living room a new identity by creating a multi-purpose family space

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty Don creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes. And Rachel de Thame revels in the seasonal displays of Azaleas in Shropshire

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef heads to his home county of Yorkshire, where he studies the landscape from above and investigates the unique environmental factors that have contributed to the creation of West Yorkshire's Rhubarb Triangle. He also examines why the region's wild heather honey is so distinctive, and prepares blow-torched mackerel served with rhubarb chutney and a honey and meringue roulade

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: James Martin makes an 'nduja sausage and sheep's cheese pizza, Steve Brown learns about a UK crop of camomile and Frances Tophill visits a woman in Somerset who grows an impressive range of Thai vegetables. Presented by Gethin Jones

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: The team looks at the automotive trade, with Ed Balls at the Port of Southampton to see how cars are driven off and on vast vessels at speed and witnessing the exhaustive checks that BMW cars must go through before they reach their owners Cherry Healey visits a Toyota factory in Derbyshire to see how workers turn millions of imported parts a day into new cars, while Ade Adepitan travels to the Tesla Gigafactory in Nevada to see how their batteries are made and what the future holds for British car manufacturing

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: The Arden family experience corner shop life in the 1980s and 1990s, when stores changed from primary shopping destinations to a place for last minute impulse buys and were forced to make the maximum use of their floor space to stock thousands of products. The programme examines the impact of new legislation allowing supermarkets to open on Sundays, previously the only advantage small businesses had over them. ABC's Martin Fry visits the shop and reveals how the band used to use empty industrial units as cheap rehearsal space, and there is a look at the rise of the gaming industry and a revival of a famous 1980s marketing stunt

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Highlights of the best finds by experts Anita Manning, Mark Stacey and others during the programme's travels around the country. Items featured include a set of Beatles autographs and a collection of Matchbox toys. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the birthplace of novelist and playwright DH Lawrence

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis take part in the final challenges before the winner is announced by Richard Osman

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has reached Lincolnshire, where his coastal railway journey from Middlesbrough ends. In Grimsby Town, he investigates a new stage in the town's history - as a maintenance base for some of the largest wind farms in the world. In neighbouring Cleethorpes, Michael rides on the Cleethorpes Coast Light Railway, pulled by a miniature steam locomotive. Later, Michael makes for a curious and wild stretch of coastline at Humberston

programme.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Ireland. Action from day two of the four-day one-off Test from Lord's. The hosts are using this contest as a warm-up for The Ashes, and will be looking to find their best form ahead of the five-Test series against Australia

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don creates colourful planting schemes with trailing plants, and Toby Buckland revels in the displays of roses at Mount Ephraim Gardens in Kent. We pay a return visit to The Linn Botanic Gardens in Argyll and Bute, where owner, Matthew Young, gets some sage advice about the precious and rare trees in his collection

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at three unique houses in the North East of England that together tell a story of wealth, industry and art in Northumbria. One of the properties is Cragside, an awe-inspiring Victorian mansion, perched in woodland on the edge of a Northumberland moor. It's the Victorian era's ultimate trophy home, built by one of its wealthiest industrialists - William Armstrong

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob and Paul travel to the Crogen Estate in north Wales to fish the River Dee for grayling, a fish that has so far eluded Paul on their extensive travels. They fish hard on a secluded private estate, with Bob displaying some very balletic moves in the river while Paul tries hard to concentrate on landing the prized fish. While Paul continues to fish, Bob decides to set up a bijou coffee shop to refresh his friend

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Documentary about the wave of industrial action that engulfed the UK at the end of 2022, with access to union leaders including Mick Lynch of the RMT and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nursing

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: When an armed gang of jewellery thieves robs ¬£300,000 worth of gold from a Birmingham jewellery store, police need to use forensic evidence to track down the gold. West Midland Police's Force Priorities Unit, a specialist team tasked with completing the most high risk jobs and manhunts, swarm the local area to find witnesses and CCTV that could give them a lead

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Happy reveals how he found his love of water

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The gang travels around in the mobile library

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli says he's a great skateboarder, but when Supertato needs his help to catch Evil Pea, Chilli can't skateboard at all! Carrot, Chilli and Supertato create a 'chilli rocket' to defeat Evil Pea.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer treats the farmer to a restaurant-style dining experience

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Paul the Potato is love-struck

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Mouse's latest experiment goes horribly wrong when he swaps brains with a house fly! With his sibling's help, Mouse frantically tries reversing the wacky situation.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A mysterious dolphin in an electronic harness zaps all the Rover's power

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The mobile unit must return a blob to London

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Elijah and Sue go head to head with Finley and Graham as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate Game on Grandparents champion.

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: Kanu the penguin gets treated for his unhappy feet, Ellie the porcupine has an injection of confidence, and Xizi the amur leopard receives some sad news

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Joel goes on a marine mission to release a sea turtle into the wild, and the cast of The Spongebob Musical perform in the studio

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: In the final episode, Steve looks back at his top Deadly Predators from the series and meets the ultimate predator. He reviews the biggest and best stunts from the series and reveals how the team bought a giant air vortex cannon to the Deadly junkyard to demonstrate the predatory prowess of the sperm whale

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith and her canine co-host Stanley open the doors of the Pooch Parlour to four more professional dog groomers out to prove their skills. First they tackle a pack of Alaskan malamutes, whose fur well and truly flies when the contestants get to work de-shedding their undercoats. They then give four fluffy puppies their first ever haircut to be revealed in front of their proud owners. Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor judge their efforts and decide who is going through to the next round

programme.title: Animals Behaving Badly
programme.desc: In the second episode, Liz Bonnin meets the animals doing whatever it takes to find food, joining experts to uncover the science behind their ingenious tactics and some of their unusual behaviour. Liz sees macaques using psychology to pull off a theft, tigers deceiving their prey, a wedge-billed hummingbird stealing nectar from under the beaks of its rivals, a spider conning prey with a chemical disguise, and coconut crabs who seem intent on a stealing spree

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The three remaining families are challenged to make a Tommy Banks favourite, a chicken kiev, before preparing a two course meal using goat's cheese and passion fruit

programme.title: GI Blues (1960)
programme.desc: A guitar-strumming soldier bets he can win the hardened heart of an unresponsive West German cabaret dancer. She rejects him when she learns about the wager, but by then he has already genuinely fallen in love with her. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, Juliet Prowse, James Douglas and Robert Ivers. Songs include Blue Suede Shoes, Tonight Is So Right For Love and the title number

programme.title: Blue Hawaii (1961)
programme.desc: A Honolulu resident returns home after two years in the army and defies his parents' wish that he work in the family pineapple business. He has set his heart on carving his own niche and makes a start by taking a job at a tourist agency. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, Angela Lansbury, Joan Blackman and Roland Winters. Songs featured include Can't Help Falling in Love and Rock-a-Hula Baby

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Muncaster Castle in Cumbria, experts James Lewis and Adam Partridge set out to find the best antiques and collectibles. Presenter Paul Martin finds out about the legendary Tom Fool, the court jester who lived at the castle and caused mayhem during some of its most turbulent times

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars, and husband and wife, Aljaz Skorjanec and Janette Manrara hunt for antiques around Oxfordshire, joined by antique experts David Harper and Izzie Balmer. An arts and crafts candlestick and a novelty vesta case feature amongst the celebrities' buys, but will a boomerang that once belonged to a star of the silver screen come back to haunt them?

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: A look at three unique houses in the North East of England that together tell a story of wealth, industry and art in Northumbria. One of the properties is Cragside, an awe-inspiring Victorian mansion, perched in woodland on the edge of a Northumberland moor. It's the Victorian era's ultimate trophy home, built by one of its wealthiest industrialists - William Armstrong

programme.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Ireland. Action from day three of the one-off Test from Lord's. The two sides have faced each other once before in this format back in 2019, when England won by 143 runs, as they bowled Ireland out for just 38 in their second innings

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Cameras follow the River Ayr as it flows from Loch Glenbuck towards the sea and the Clyde coast. In the Ayr Gorge, Paul Murton encounters the tale of radical preacher Alexander Peden, whose life on the run forced him to hide in caves while still preaching hell-fire sermons to the people

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: A major from Area HQ decides Corporal Jones is too old to be in the Home Guard, asking him to prove his worth by completing an assault course - leaving the rest of the platoon hatching a plan to help him. Comedy first broadcast in 1968, starring Clive Dunn, Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Black Music Legends of the 1980s
programme.desc: Profile of the enigmatic American musician, who rose to fame in the 1980s with hits including 1999, Kiss and Raspberry Beret. As well as achieving significant commercial success around the world, he won critical acclaim for his adventurous, genre-blurring albums, such as Sign O' the Times and Around the World in a Day - while also making headlines for his sexually explicit lyrics and stage shows, as well as his legal battle to retain control of his name and music. Featuring contributions by guitarist Dez Dickerson, Public Enemy frontman Chuck D, soul singer Beverley Knight and Paisley Park label president Alan Leeds

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Oxford rocker and Supergrass frontman Gaz Coombes performs songs from his solo album Turn the Car Around, and former Rudimental singer Mahalia appears in her own right with her latest Single Terms and Conditions. Two duos take to the stage of Alexandra Palace in north London - Grammy winning guitarists Rodrigo Y Gabriela, with a couple of numbers from their sixth album In Between Thought - A New World, which was inspired by the pair's discovery of Hindu philosophy, and Brighton rockers Royal Blood, as they prepare for festival season. Completing the line-up is Kara Johnson from Illinois, the former US Youth Poet Laureate whose music is a blend of folk and alt-country

programme.title: Prince and the Revolution
programme.desc: A performance by Prince and the Revolution from the 1985 Purple Rain tour at the Syracuse Carrier Dome in New York, remixed, remastered and visually enhanced. The film features hits from the popular albums Purple Rain, Controversy and 1999, including an 18-minute version of Purple Rain

programme.title: Purple Rain (1984)
programme.desc: A talented singer tries to escape his troubled home life through his music. However, his arrogant nature puts him in danger of alienating his band and losing the fellow performer he loves to a charismatic rival. Musical drama, starring Prince, Apollonia Kotero, Morris Day and Olga Karlatos. The soundtrack features hits including the title track, Let's Go Crazy and the Oscar-winning When Doves Cry

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at the growth of paramilitary organisations in the early 1970s, with killings, explosions, intimidation and street disorder becoming widespread - with devastating and often lasting effects. Coercive control, intimidation, beatings and executions were part of how these groups operated in their different communities, a world in which people could be 'disappeared'', never to be found for decades afterwards

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don creates colourful planting schemes with trailing plants, and Toby Buckland revels in the displays of roses at Mount Ephraim Gardens in Kent. We pay a return visit to The Linn Botanic Gardens in Argyll and Bute, where owner, Matthew Young, gets some sage advice about the precious and rare trees in his collection

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Lizzie Schofield and Calum Clunie look at common tasks for the garden at this time of year, giving expert advice on bedding plants, hanging baskets and lawn care. Carole Baxter is visiting a beautiful garden in Aberdeen and there is a chance to have a look at amazing private gardens rarely open to the public

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits the East Neuk of Fife to see out how this small area has become such a big local food destination. He visits the Balcaskie Estate farm to see its Red Lincoln herd and pops into the butchery where the beef is sold. Dougie meets up with chef Nick Nairn, who rustles up a beef dish that celebrates the quality of produce from this area. In the Borders, Rosie Morton discovers why one farmer is planting and restoring hedgerows, while in Deeside Arlene Stuart goes in search of Scotland's only native snake - the elusive adder

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler tries to become self-sufficient in fruit and vegetables as she uses her small back garden to plant, grow and harvest her own produce. She begins with peas and beans, and provides useful growing tips as well as recipes including broad-bean falafels and pea-shoot cocktails. She also forages for willow to make plant supports and buys two chickens

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: Four new families enter the kitchen - the Mistrys from south London, the Whittakers from Lancashire, the Walker-Kings from Wandsworth and the Varmas from Walsall. They are tasked with making a ¬£10 single-pot dish from a surprise selection of ingredients, before being challenged to put their own spin on fishcakes. As ever, presenters-cum-judges Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks will decide which three families will make it through to tomorrow's heat

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: The chef continues his culinary tour of Spain by travelling east from the Basque region toward the Mediterranean coast, sampling a selection of great dishes and enjoying local hospitality along the way

programme.title: D-Day the Sixth of June (1956)
programme.desc: A British colonel and an American captain board a ship heading out on a dangerous mission as part of the Normandy Landings. As the two men prepare for the battle to come, they both reminisce about their love for the same woman. Second World War drama, starring Robert Taylor, Richard Todd, Dana Wynter and Edmond O'Brien

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938)
programme.desc: An outlawed nobleman living deep in Sherwood Forest recruits a band of merry men to steal from the cruel Norman aristocracy and redistribute the wealth to the downtrodden peasants. However, they soon face a more pressing task - stopping the evil Prince John and his ally Sir Guy of Gisborne from seizing King Richard's throne. Swashbuckling adventure, with Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone and Claude Rains

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The experts are in Reading to value items, with Anita Manning falling in love with a couple of American dolls and Nick Nick Davies finding some 19th-century French paperweights that get pulses racing at the auction. Presenter Paul Martin takes a trip to Cliveden House, which was at the centre of two important events in British politics in the 20th century

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers are tasked with making garments for a travel wardrobe, starting with a good sturdy rucksack. For the transformation they head to the seaside to sculpt windbreakers into emergency rainwear before creating some made-to-measure swimsuits

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: The actor explores the cuisine of Bologna, the capital of Emilia-Romagna and home to the highest number of protected food products in the whole of Italy. He is driven by chef Massimo Bottura to a premium parmigiano producer, where they break open a fresh wheel, before travelling to Rimini on the Adriatic coast to meet Francesca Fellini, the niece of director Federico Fellini, to try the distinctive cappelletti pasta

programme.title: Cricket: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Ireland. Action from the conclusion of the four-day one-off Test from Lord's. The hosts were using this contest as a warm-up for The Ashes, and will have been looking to find their best form ahead of the five-Test series against Australia

programme.title: Simon Reeve's South America
programme.desc: The last leg of Simon's journey through South America takes him from Chile's Atacama Desert right down to Tierra Del Fuego, the most southerly inhabited place on Earth. In the Atacama, one of the driest places on the planet with is as little as 1mm of rain per year, Simon discovers shocking evidence of human pollution

programme.title: Gods of Tennis
programme.desc: Framed through the world-famous Wimbledon tournament, this series revisits a golden age of tennis during the 1970s and '80s that changed the sport forever. The series begins in 1975 as two tennis greats - Billie Jean King and Arthur Ashe - aim to win Wimbledon titles but also, in their own ways, to change the world for the better. Back in the late '60s, as the women's liberation movement becomes headline news, King took up the gauntlet for women in sport, spearheading the drive for equal prize money and equal treatment of women

programme.title: All the Beauty and the Bloodshed
programme.desc: An Oscar-nominated profile of renowned artist and activist Nan Goldin, using slideshows, interviews, photography and rare footage to tell the story of her personal fight to hold the Sackler family accountable for the opioid overdose crisis

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: After breaking up, Ashley and Gordon must find a new home for Colin the dog so they can go their separate ways. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Wildlife (2018)
programme.desc: A teenage boy must deal with his mother's complicated response after his father temporarily abandons them to take a menial and dangerous job. Drama directed by Paul Dano, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Carey Mulligan and Ed Oxenbould

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Leicester. programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Folk performances by artists including Pete Seeger, Tim Buckley, Joan Baez, Bob Dylan and Leonard Cohen

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Chemotherapy takes its toll on Ester. Jorund tries to make up with Charlotte but suspects she may be hiding bigger secrets. Lars invites love interest Miko on a date. In Norwegian

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Ester wonders whether she has the strength to continue with the harshness of her treatment. Arild is invited to Japan on a once-in-a-life time work trip. Jorund gets a nasty shock. In Norwegian

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc: Ester gets to find out if the treatment she endured has worked. Jorund must decide if he intends to forgive Charlotte, and Finn reveals a big secret he has been carrying around for many years. In Norwegian

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Documentary about American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. With unprecedented access to gang members' memoirs, family archives and recently released police records, Timewatch searches for the true story of the couple and their mob. While Hollywood portrayed the pair as the most glamorous outlaws in American history, the reality of life on the run was one of violence, hardship and danger. Narrated by Michael Praed

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging

programme.title: Holst and Vaughan Williams: Making Music English
programme.desc: Historian Amanda Vickery and broadcaster Tom Service unearth the fascinating story of the life-long friendship between composers Ralph Vaughan Williams and Gustav Holst, whose music gave birth to the 'English sound' in the first half of the 20th century. They retrace the walking trips the two composers took together across the country to discover how influences ranging from the Renaissance masters to the folk genre imbued their music with the 'Englishness' recognised today

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Mark Wigglesworth, perform Vaughan Williams' pastoral masterpiece The Lark Ascending, with the orchestra's leader Zoe Beyers on violin. The concert, from Manchester's Bridgewater Hall, also features Elgar's Symphony No 2 and Wagner's prelude to his last music-drama work, Parsifal

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: Clemency Burton-Hill explores the life of Antonio Stradivari, a 17th-century violin-maker who created over one thousand stringed instruments. Visiting the Stradivarius exhibition at the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, she examines four of the violins and is joined by 2002 Young Musician of the Year winner Jennifer Pike to test some of them out

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: A record-breaking tennis player on the court and a boundary-busting social activist off the court, Billie Jean King talks to Amol Rajan about her extraordinary life and career. She discusses her lifelong battle for equality and inclusion, and how she has balanced her activism with both a sports career and a tumultuous personal life

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the little-known story of sports legend Arthur Ashe off the tennis court. Known to most on account of his stellar sports career - he became the first black man to win Wimbledon in 1975 - the film uncovers Ashe's work as a social activist, a role that embraced not only the civil rights movement in the US and African Americans but all oppressed peoples throughout the world

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: Inside Classical

programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.title: Love Monster

Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Love Monster has no idea how he can pick a winner and runs off and hides, but then he realises Bad Idea Puppy always makes him laugh, so he declares him the winner.

He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Following a group of women from Wales as they participate in an event aiming to set a new world record for the largest gathering of female motorcyclists. Organiser Sherrie started her biking journey 16 years ago, had began riding at a younger age, and says she would rather have been a motorcycle racer rather her actual career as an accountant. The current record stands at 1,132, but Sherrie intends to smash this record and gain recognition for the more than 300,000 female motorbike license holders in the UK

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway and the team travel to the point where the counties of Carmarthenshire, Pembrokeshire and Ceredigion all meet to follow the course of the River Teifi between Cenarth and Cilgerran. On the way he learns to steer a coracle. Matt Bassett visits possibly the prettiest producers' market on the Teifi estuary and Dr Jeni Millard discovers the story of Wales' smallest museum

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A look at how Wales' greatest ever Paralympian, Tanni Grey-Thompson, recovered from the disappointment of failing to medal in the 800m at the 2004 Athens Paralympics, typically her strongest event, by going on to win golds in the 100m and 400m

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond visits the East Neuk of Fife to see out how this small area has become such a big local food destination. He visits the Balcaskie Estate farm to see its Red Lincoln herd and pops into the butchery where the beef is sold. Dougie meets up with chef Nick Nairn, who rustles up a beef dish that celebrates the quality of produce from this area. In the Borders, Rosie Morton discovers why one farmer is planting and restoring hedgerows, while in Deeside Arlene Stuart goes in search of Scotland's only native snake - the elusive adder

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann, British gymnastics great Beth Tweddle, seven-time snooker world champion Stephen Hendry and BBC sports presenter JJ Chalmers join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Have I Got News for You

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: Gang member Tevin grows suspicious of Dom and Kay after following them to Hackney police station. Posing as volunteer visitors, the undercover duo set about investigating Riverford Residential Home, suspecting it could be a front for the Brightmarsh Gang. Dom makes an unlikely elderly ally and Kay's commitment to community service finally pays dividends. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: Bump

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: Sportscene Live
programme.desc: Celtic v Inverness Caledonian Thistle (Kick-off 5.30pm). All the action from the Scottish Cup final at Hampden Park. The last of treble-chasing Celtic's record 40 triumphs in this competition came in 2020, when they defeated Hearts on penalties, while the only time Caley have lifted the trophy was in 2015, when they overcame Falkirk

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain is called out to a multi-vehicle crash caused by a man jumping from a bridge. The crisis forces him to relive traumatic memories of the events that led to his partner's death, and makes him question his relationship with a still struggling Faith. Jodie comes to see a different side to her father, Cam finds himself lodging with unexpected company, and Paige receives some troubling news

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A scientist's body is found in Loch Katrine, a case that reminds Annika of a play by Ibsen. But with so many people wanting the victim dead, which one did he push over the edge? Away from work, the DI takes more than a parental interest in Morgan's therapist. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Lionel Messi: Destiny
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes documentary looking at how the Argentina star, won the World Cup for the first time in his illustrious career last year in Qatar. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Celtic v Inverness Caledonian Thistle. Jonathan Sutherland presents highlights of the showpiece match, held at Hampden Park

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Stephen meets 50-year-old Caroline from Newry, who has been struggling with weight since she started the menopause and often turns to crisps and snacks to keep her energy levels up. Her recent weight gain is affecting her joints and she's worried that if she doesn't change her ways, she may lose the ability to do this and remain active and sociable. Chef Shauna Froydenlund has so many ideas and tastes for Caroline and Stephen to try. However, when Shauna's dish turns out to be Caroline's food hell, there's the potential for things in the kitchen to go terribly wrong

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Patrick Bradley meets ordinary people on a mission to restore and transform some of Northern Ireland's historic buildings. Beginning in east Belfast, Patrick meets a couple looking to future proof their lives by downsizing from a large family house to a small 19th-century gate lodge with plans to restore and extend it to create their dream home. While building work is underway, the host explores what life would have been like when the gate lodge was originally built and the house it served, which was once owned by the first Prime Minister of Northern Ireland, James Craig

Kaye Adams, Kai Widdrington, Kelly Cates, Jill Douglas, Lucy Porter, Kevin Eldon, Dr Daniel Olaiya, Dr Raphael Olaiya try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain is called out to a multi-vehicle crash caused by a man jumping from a bridge. The crisis forces him to relive traumatic memories of the events that led to his partner's death, and makes him question his relationship with a still struggling Faith. Jodie comes to see a different side to her father, Cam finds himself lodging with unexpected company, and Paige receives some troubling news

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A scientist's body is found in Loch Katrine, a case that reminds Annika of a play by Ibsen. But with so many people wanting the victim dead, which one did he push over the edge? Away from work, the DI takes more than a parental interest in Morgan's therapist. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Lionel Messi: Destiny
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes documentary looking at how the Argentina star, won the World Cup for the first time in his illustrious career last year in Qatar. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Iorram - Boat Song
programme.desc: A cinema documentary entirely in Scottish Gaelic, Iorram (Boat Song) is a lyrical portrait of life in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, past and present. Director Alastair Cole takes the audience on an immersive journey into the heart and soul of a 1000-year-old community, blending archive sound recordings of voices from the past with visuals of island life today and an original score by acclaimed folk musician Aidan O'Rourke. At the core of the film is an extraordinary trove of sound archive, recorded by pioneering Scottish ethnographers in the mid-20th century, who visited the Western Isles to capture the hardship and romance of life lived in precarious balance with the sea. These newly restored recordings preserve an oral history of lore and legends, tall tales and tragedies, passed down through generations of Gaelic speakers. This soundtrack of voices, stories and songs from the past is accompanied by moving imagery of the daily working rhythm of the islands, on land and on water, shot ov
