With the heroes' team in disarray, Monkie Kid and Ne Zha try desperately to stop the Monkey King from confronting the Lady Bone Demon on his own. Mei learns how to control the Samadhi Fire with Red Son, but when Monkie Kid catches up to the Monkey King, it seems that his mentor might actually stand a chance of defeating her!

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Lady Bone Demon successfully overcomes the Monkey King and now has the perfect champion to complete her 'destiny' - Monkie Kid reunites with Mei and Red Son, but before they can come up with a plan, the corrupted Monkey King arrives to take Mei and the Samadhi Fire to his new master. Now Monkie Kid and the heroes will need to fight their strongest opponent ever...

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.30 Betfred Derby, plus a support race at 12.50. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Johnny Murtagh, and reports by Rishi Persad, Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Mick Fitzgerald, while Chris Hughes, Mark Heyes and Charlotte Hawkins cover events away from the racecourse. Betting news with Brian Gleeson, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the showpiece match between the rivals at Wembley Stadium. City have already secured the Premier League title and are now looking to complete a treble by lifting both this trophy and the UEFA Champions League next week. However, United will relish preventing their neighbours from emulating their 1999 achievement and have also won silverware themselves this term, having lifted the Carabao Cup in February. With analysis from Roy Keane, Joleon Lescott, Ian Wright, Laura Woods and Karen Carney, commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon and Ally McCoist, and reports from Gabriel Clarke and Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most thrilling and nerve-racking endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Eastbourne, where he plays Mum's the Word, the Leaning Tower of Poundsa and brand-new game Escalator Spectator, before finishing the series with one last round of In for a Penny

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as comedian Dane Baptiste, ex-rugby referee Nigel Owens, presenter Anita Rani and sports broadcaster Mark Pougatch pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for the charity of their choice. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to ¬£100,000?

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: A special compilation episode of Deep Fake Neighbour Wars - the show that uses Deep Fake technology to turn the UK's best new impressionists into the world's most famous celebrities - only here they are ordinary people who happen to be embroiled in petty neighbour disputes. In this episode, Andy Murray and his mum, Lorraine Kelly, clash with RuPaul over noisy chickens, Idris Elba gets a shock when new neighbour Kim Kardashian starts making her presence known in their communal garden, and Greta Thunberg is upset by Conor McGregor and Ariane Grande's perennial Christmas decorations

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rocky (1976)
programme.desc: Philadelphia brawler Rocky Balboa gets a shot at the world heavyweight title when current champion Apollo Creed decides to give an unknown boxer a chance in celebration of America's bicentennial. Oscar-winning drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young and Carl Weathers

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The father and son duo's road trip takes them to Nicaragua, where they meet some colourful characters in the local market, and get a taste of the national sport when they join a professional baseball team. With the country renowned for its volcanoes, the pair take one of their most dangerous and spectacular challenges, as they descend into an active volcano

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Sucked into the vacuum cleaner, Catastrophe Jim tries to convince Lloyd, Abacus and PB that they are now in the afterlife. Lloyd refuses to believe that a life as significant as his could be over so soon, so he sets out to prove that they're still alive.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is cross when Berry brings his parents fruit fresh from the fridge - if anyone's going to raid the fridge, it should be him! Lloyd and Abacus therefore head to the fridge with Berry as their guide, but they find themselves unprepared for the cold...

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is convinced that her mother would be very disappointed if they didn't participate in the town's Familimbo together. But they are both stiffer than wooden planks! To avoid a guaranteed humiliation, Sam asks for the power of elasticity. Unfortunately for her, while her body does stretch and twist in impossible ways... it doesn't snap back to its initial shape. So off Sam goes on her crazy mollusc-like adventure to find Mo...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo dreams of joining the highly selective Robotics Club, but in order to do that, he needs to crack a particularly tough puzzle: he must assemble the three pieces that make up the club badge. He therefore asks the Spectral Scepter for the power of super glue. It works like a charm... too much so in fact: it's impossible to unglue anything from his body...!

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg, Gabriele Ferzetti and Bernard Lee

Players position themselves in a row of seats one behind another, with one wrong answer seeing them relegated to the back of the line and in real danger of leaving with nothing

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec return to host the grand finale of the talent search, while Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli form the judging panel. Taking to stage are the acts who secured the judges' and public votes across the semi-finals, but the public vote alone determines the outcome of the final, where the chosen favourite will be named the winner of Britain's Got Talent 2023. As always, the victor will also be leaving the competition with the life-changing ¬£250,000 cash prize and a coveted place at the Royal Variety Performance

programme.desc: A hitman working for a longtime friend who has become head of a crime syndicate becomes disillusioned with his life and haunted by his past misdeeds. He is forced to turn against the syndicate and place himself in the firing line when he learns a hit has been ordered on his own estranged son. Director Jaume Collet-Serra's action thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Ed Harris, Joel Kinnaman and Boyd Holbrook

Taking to stage are the acts who secured the judges' and public votes across the semi-finals, but the public vote alone determines the outcome of the final, where the chosen favourite will be named the winner of Britain's Got Talent 2023. As always, the victor will also be leaving the competition with the life-changing ¬£250,000 cash prize and a coveted place at the Royal Variety Performance

programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Drama, starring Jason Durr, Bill Maynard, Mark Jordon and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Maggie's suspicions are aroused by the death of a close friend's mother, so she goes straight to the police to report her fears, leading to a cruel dilemma. Meanwhile, jealousy rears its ugly head when one of Blaketon's old flames comes back on the scene and starts taking an interest in Lord Ashfordly. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lives are put on the line as Mike and Jackie receive orders to provide a refuge for a dangerous police informant, and David is left in charge of Greengrass's house while the old rogue is living it up in the Caribbean _ but does not count on an unexpected visitor making himself at home. Drama, starring Fiona Dolman, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock is smitten by the charms of newcomer Susan Finlay, only to face a quandary when her son is charged with dangerous driving. Elsewhere, PC Bellamy rashly turns to the casino table and Vernon inadvertently causes chaos on a bride's big day. Starring Philip Franks, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel meets Sean's son, who turns out to be an eight-year-old version of his dad, and the idea of becoming a stepmum puts her further off the idea of marriage than she was before - not that she even agreed in the first place. Andy asks Janet out for a drink, but when she turns him down he accuses her of leading him on. A woman in a sexy cop's uniform turns up dead, and the DCI assumes the killer was her lover - the question is, which one of her many lovers was it? And to add to the mystery, why was her face painted green?

programme.desc: A farmer's murder and the crash landing of an enemy plane lead Foyle to investigate the activities of a group of land girls, and the detective begins to suspect the captured German airmen have something to hide. programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: American GIs arrive in Hastings to a mixed welcome and Foyle is called on to calm the locals. But his attempts at soothing relations are jeopardised when a barmaid's involvement with a visiting soldier results in murder, leading the detective to defy orders to keep the peace and solve the case. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell, Honeysuckle Weeks and Keith Barron

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A local woman is killed when an experiment in biological warfare goes tragically wrong. Sam also falls victim to a potentially fatal illness as a result of the project. Foyle is forced to head into the most secretive and dangerous areas of wartime research, unearthing secrets that cannot be revealed even to the prime minister. Michael Kitchen stars, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Philip Franks

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: The Dutch detective is called in to investigate the gruesome murder of Susie de Windt, a solicitor whose mutilated body was discovered strung up on a windfarm with an 'X' carved into her stomach and a cryptic note inside her coat. He discovers that days previously, she had won a case on behalf of the city to evict a group of artist squatters, and the windfarm where her body was discovered was where they were due to be relocated.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Meanwhile, new recruit Sgt Rob Waddington arrives on the scene - putting Janet's nose out of joint as she is demoted back down to constable. Emmerdale star Danny Miller (Aaron Livesy) joins the cast

programme.desc: Maria struggles to cope with her guilt, an unexpected offer gives Steve food for thought and Sunita leaves Tracy speechless after revealing the truth about Dev and Deirdre

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy tells Deirdre she knows about her little fling with Dev last Christmas, giving her mother no choice but to come clean to Ken just as he is preparing to go to court

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack feel guilty about an accident in the bus, so they volunteer to care for the Inspector's pets while he is on holiday. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A flu epidemic hits the depot, improving Stan's financial health as he and Jack clock up overtime. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Strange things are happening at Leopard's Den as Danny prepares to leave for the UK. Frogs have seemingly rained down overnight, the giraffe refuses to budge from the front gate and the cheetah has lost its appetite. Danny jumps at the chance to have one last adventure before his return home - tracking a lioness that attacked a tourist - but it could end in tragedy. Meanwhile, Du Plessis makes an alarming discovery about Ed and Fiona

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: As Christmas comes to Aidensfield, the locals have their very own Scrooge to contend with in the shape of mean-spirited bank manager Gordon Stringer. With farmer Jack Dugdale at his mercy and Greengrass on the prowl for money he is owed, his son Noel becomes fed up of taking the flak for his father's unpopularity and runs away. Drama, starring Jason Durr, Bill Maynard, Mark Jordon and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Maggie's suspicions are aroused by the death of a close friend's mother, so she goes straight to the police to report her fears, leading to a cruel dilemma. The district nurse's emotional day comes to an end when she announces her decision to leave Aidensfield, prompting the locals to throw a farewell party. Meanwhile, jealousy rears its ugly head when one of Blaketon's old flames comes back on the scene and starts taking an interest in Lord Ashfordly. Rural drama, starring Kazia Pelka, Derek Fowlds and Janie Dee

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn's optimism fades as she struggles to cope, Andy offers to pay for Robert's car, and Daz gets into yet more trouble

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre implores a furious Ken to forgive her infidelity. Tracy confronts Dev over his fling with her mother, and Karen strikes a deal with Joe behind Steve's back

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A crestfallen Ken decides to pay Dev a visit, Karen goes behind Steve's back and finds a tenant for the Streetcars flat and Fred's new romance leaves Ashley and Maxine stunned

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When Grace Phillips is killed in an explosion in a munitions factory, Foyle is asked by one of her co-workers to investigate the death. Initially he concludes a tragic accident has occurred until another woman is found murdered and Foyle starts to believe the deaths are connected. Wartime drama, starring Michael Kitchen

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lives are put on the line as Mike and Jackie receive orders to provide a refuge for a dangerous police informant, and David is left in charge of Greengrass's house while the old rogue is living it up in the Caribbean _ but does not count on an unexpected visitor making himself at home. Drama, starring Fiona Dolman, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock is smitten by the charms of newcomer Susan Finlay, only to face a quandary when her son is charged with dangerous driving. Elsewhere, PC Bellamy rashly turns to the casino table and Vernon inadvertently causes chaos on a bride's big day. Starring Philip Franks, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet comes face to face with the man who left her fighting for life just months earlier - serial killer Geoff Hastings, who has vowed to finally reveal the full extent of his crimes. Rachel and the rest of the team investigate the racially motivated murder of a taxi driver. On the personal front, Andy refuses to take no for an answer, so Janet threatens to report him to the DCI. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones, with an appearance by Kevin Doyle (Downton Abbey's Molesley)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel meets Sean's son, who turns out to be an eight-year-old version of his dad, and the idea of becoming a stepmum puts her further off the idea of marriage than she was before - not that she even agreed in the first place. Andy asks Janet out for a drink, but when she turns him down he accuses her of leading him on. A woman in a sexy cop's uniform turns up dead, and the DCI assumes the killer was her lover - the question is, which one of her many lovers was it? And to add to the mystery, why was her face painted green?

programme.desc: The master of a prestigious college asks Morse to investigate the disappearance of one of his colleagues. The subsequent discovery of a dismembered torso soon has everyone fearing the worst - until the missing man turns up alive and well. Starring John Thaw, Kevin Whately, James Grout, Beatie Edney, Sian Thomas and Barry Foster

programme.title: Carry On Don't Lose Your Head (1966)
programme.desc: A cunning English nobleman puts his talent for disguise to good use by rescuing aristocrats from execution during the French Revolution. However, the leader of the secret police is determined to unmask the elusive hero spiriting the nobility out from under the guillotine. Comedy spoof of the Scarlet Pimpernel story, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims, Jim Dale and Charles Hawtrey

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A farmer's murder and the crash landing of an enemy plane lead Foyle to investigate the activities of a group of land girls, and the detective begins to suspect the captured German airmen have something to hide. Stella Gonet and James Wilby guest star in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. When an engineer is murdered just hours after working at the shipyard, the detectives desperately try to track down the killer and discover the truth surrounding the Talbots' shady business dealings. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: American GIs arrive in Hastings to a mixed welcome and Foyle is called on to calm the locals. But his attempts at soothing relations are jeopardised when a barmaid's involvement with a visiting soldier results in murder, leading the detective to defy orders to keep the peace and solve the case. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell, Honeysuckle Weeks and Keith Barron

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A local woman is killed when an experiment in biological warfare goes tragically wrong. Sam also falls victim to a potentially fatal illness as a result of the project. Foyle is forced to head into the most secretive and dangerous areas of wartime research, unearthing secrets that cannot be revealed even to the prime minister. Michael Kitchen stars, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Philip Franks

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: The Dutch detective is called in to investigate the gruesome murder of Susie de Windt, a solicitor whose mutilated body was discovered strung up on a windfarm with an 'X' carved into her stomach and a cryptic note inside her coat. He discovers that days previously, she had won a case on behalf of the city to evict a group of artist squatters, and the windfarm where her body was discovered was where they were due to be relocated.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Meanwhile, new recruit Sgt Rob Waddington arrives on the scene - putting Janet's nose out of joint as she is demoted back down to constable. Emmerdale star Danny Miller (Aaron Livesy) joins the cast

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A diary and a parking ticket are found at a murder scene in a multi-storey car park. On the personal front, the Oxford detective's feathers are ruffled by a woman he finds himself attracted to. John Thaw, Kevin Whately, Mel Martin and Amanda Hillwood star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom

programme.title: Carry On Doctor (1967)
programme.desc: A popular doctor is sacked after a misunderstanding ruins his reputation, prompting the furious patients to stage a revolt against the luckless medic's strait-laced superiors. Meanwhile, the hospital head has his own problems after becoming the unlikely romantic target of a strict matron. Comedy, with Frankie Howerd, Jim Dale, Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: An Audience with Ronnie Corbett
programme.desc: The comedian entertains his peers, fans, friends and family with jokes and ramblings in a show recorded in 1997. Celebrity audience members include Donald Sinden, Martin Jarvis, Gorden Kaye, Lynda Bellingham, Norman Bowler, Kevin Lloyd and Desmond Llewelyn. Ronnie Barker also joins the host on stage to re-create some of the magic of the Two Ronnies

programme.title: Foyle's War

programme.desc: Action from day two at Madison Square Garden in New York, featuring the quarter-finals, semi-finals and final. Commentary comes from Stuart Pyke, Dan Dawson and Mark Webster

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Young physiotherapist Lizzie Faulkner is shot dead while enjoying a holiday at a luxury country retreat. The resulting murder investigation unearths betrayal, guilt and the desire for atonement - as Vera moves quickly to avoid another tragedy, and Joe tries to make amends with the demons of his past. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Paul Ritter and Eva Quinn

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective delves into the past of extreme sports enthusiast Gideon Frane after he plunges from a cliff in a ball of flames. A scan of the files reveals a long list of stalking complaints against an ex, and an anonymous letter to the victim spelling out Burn in Hell is linked to one of her friends. Aided by DC Shepherd and the newly appointed DC Edwards, the team tries to track down Gideon's old gang to uncover a lifetime of bullying and an unexpected story of rough justice

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth spends Christmas apart from Lawrence, confessing her sorrows to her parents, but a surprise lies in store for the Bellamys. Meanwhile, tension brews between Hudson and Thomas. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Having realised her marriage is a mistake, Rachel is still staying at Janet's and making excuses for her absence, but Sean isn't prepared to accept that things have gone so wrong, so quickly. Meanwhile, the investigation into Joe Bevan continues as the body count rises and the team faces the mammoth task of identifying the victims and determining the order in which they were murdered. Detective drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Sean Maguire

programme.desc: Templar is called in to help a Russian physicist who wants to defect to America. Vintage adventure, starring Roger Moore, with Guy Deghy, Anthony Booth and Yootha Joyce

programme.desc: An elderly widow enlists Holmes' help to ascertain why a mystery purchaser should want to buy not just her house, but also all its contents. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Peter Wyngarde

Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Horror - Mo forgot to do his art studio homework! He fills the gap in a flash by taking one of his mother's anatomical models to school to pass it off as his own creation. It works, but Selina quickly realises that the foot is missing and warns Mo that he'll be in serious trouble - to make things worse, the model foot is stuffed with Mo's favourite video game, the one that Selina took from him and hid! Mo therefore has to break into Brick's office in order to get it back.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is due to take part in an eloquence contest whose prize was won by her mother and her grandmother when they were young - the pressure is on Sam, and that makes her unbelievably tense. Sam realises that she is lost for words when she feels stressed - to avoid catastrophe, she asks the Sceptre for the power of repartee. The half-power does provide her with snappy answers, but they are extremely caustic, and that's just the start of her problems...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo thinks that he's going to become a star when Mr Brick chooses him to represent the school in his new advertising campaign, but Mo instead finds his face on a huge billboard with a line telling everybody that he is a very poor student. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Springtime is a time of new life - it's a time where the Dales and the Lakes flourish. In Grasmere, sheep farmers Peter and Robert Bland are marking up their new lambs, before setting them and their mothers free on the open fell. On the Castle Bolton Estate in the Dales, head gamekeeper Ian Sleightholm and his children offer a hand to licenced bird ringer David Baines, as they capture and ring chicks no longer so common across the country. Because of Ian's management of the moor, species such as the lapwing, curlew and merlin have found a haven. In Wensleydale, a private woodland has become a sanctuary for another rare British breed - the red squirrel

programme.desc: As the country goes into lockdown in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic in March 2020, the Tower is forced to close its gates for the first time since the Second World War. programme.title: The Fall of Anne Boleyn

As the two families from opposite ends of the wealth divide live in each other' homes for a week, Bradley and Heather enjoy Abi's fabulous luxurious home, which has the most beautiful kitchen Heather has ever seen, and ¬£1,200 to spend, while Abi and her two children Thomas and Ellie have just ¬£87 to live off

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: The Tin Star (1957)
programme.desc: A world-weary bounty hunter, formerly a sheriff, arrives in a small town where a newly-appointed lawman is struggling to keep the peace. When he learns of the mercenary's past, the inexperienced lawman seeks his help in learning the tricks of the trade so he can bring an outlaw gang to justice. Anthony Mann's Western, starring Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins, Lee Van Cleef, Betsy Palmer and Michel Ray

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Transformers (2007)
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro

programme.title: Ronin (1998)
programme.desc: A freelance former US intelligence agent is recruited alongside a team of fellow mercenaries to take part in an international plot to capture a briefcase from a gang of criminals. However, after the mission is completed, one member of the crew decides to betray his equally ruthless comrades-in-arms - with inevitably explosive results. John Frankenheimer's action thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Jean Reno, Natascha McElhone, Sean Bean, Stellan Skarsgard and Jonathan Pryce

programme.title: Snatch (2000)
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince an Irish gypsy to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchie's comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham

programme.title: Blindspotting (2018)
programme.desc: A man struggles to finish the last days of his probation, haunted by an incident in which he witnessed a white police officer shoot down a fleeing black man in the back. He then begins to re-evaluate his relationship with his volatile best friend. Crime drama with a light-hearted edge, starring Daveed Diggs and Rafael Casal

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: Home Alone (1990)
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011)
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: Let Him Go (2020)
programme.desc: Retired sheriff George Blackledge and his horse trainer wife Margaret live on a ranch in 1960s Montana, with their son James, his wife Lorna and their son Jimmy. A freak riding accident takes James' life, and the Blackledges watch helplessly as Lorna eventually marries Donnie, who communicates with his fists. Without warning, Donnie spirits Lorna and three-year-old Jimmy away to his family home in North Dakota. Crime drama, starring Diane Lane, Kevin Costner and Kayli Carter

programme.title: The Empty Man (2020)
programme.desc: When an ex-cop is trailing a missing girl, he comes across a secret group attempting to summon a terrifying supernatural entity. Mystery horror, starring James Badge Dale, Marin Ireland, Sasha Frolova, Samantha Logan and Virginia Kull

programme.title: #Horror (2015)
programme.desc: Six pre-adolescent girls face a night of terror when an online social media game goes horrifyingly wrong, turning a moment of cyber-bullying into a night of insanity. Crime horror, starring Emma Adler, Jessica Blank and Ted Christensen

programme.title: The Great Escape (1963)
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots are driven into hiding when the human race turns against them. When rediscovered by a kindly inventor and his daughter, they come out of exile to save the world, battling a new breed of human-created Transformers. These deadly new machines were created to hunt them down, but are now growing independent and intend to make use of technology from the Transformers' home planet in a plot that could threaten all life on Earth. Fourth film in the sci-fi adventure series, starring Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight (2017)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots and their human allies face a confrontation with their original creator, who has brainwashed their leader and intends to save her own home planet by destroying Earth. To save the human race they must recover an ancient artefact from Arthurian legend - but their mission is threatened by old enemies as they uncover a terrible secret about the history of the world. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg, Anthony Hopkins, Gemma Chan, Stanley Tucci and John Turturro

programme.title: Bloodshot (2020)
programme.desc: Marine Ray Garrison is shot dead during a mission but regains consciousness in Kuala Lumpur in the care of Dr Emil Harting. The medic brought Ray back to life using nanotechnology, augmenting the Marine's strength, agility, speed and healing capabilities on the battlefield. Rechristened Bloodshot, Garrison wages top-secret war alongside other enhanced killing machines, while piecing together a conspiracy that robbed him of the woman he loved. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Eiza Gonzalez and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Black Rain (1989)
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda

programme.title: Woman at War (2018)
programme.desc: An Icelandic environmental activist single-handedly fights a campaign of illegal sabotage against the aluminium industry. Her priorities shift when her application to adopt a Ukrainian orphan is accepted, leaving her struggling to balance the future of the Earth with the immediate needs of her child. Comedy drama, starring Halld√≥ra Geirhar√∞sd√≥ttir and J√≥hann Sigur√∞arson. In Icelandic, English, Ukrainian, Chinese and Spanish

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy takes drastic action when she believes her late husband's phone box is being removed from the village, and her behaviour worries Zara and Grace

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yazz has a big decision to make about her future, Grace and Zara decide to confront Cindy about her recent behaviour, and Ethan and Sienna put their plan into motion

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Tina receives unexpected news, Calvin, Dave and Gemma encourage her to embrace it

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: A surprise delivery prompts Dave and Gemma to examine the power dynamics in their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny runs into money troubles, so Sheldon offers to lend her some cash to help her pay the rent. However, when Leonard discovers his neighbour's ex-boyfriend Kurt is the cause of her financial woes, he gathers the gang for a confrontation. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicist's mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt on a city councillor, while Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A new captain at the Nine-Nine attempts to ingratiate herself with Jake and the squad by inviting them over to her house for a dinner party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howard's hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesn't stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadette's disapproval

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Penny's living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon succeeds in getting Penny to conform to his high standards, so Leonard adopts a similar strategy for his romantic gain. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj meet two women at a goth nightclub and things appear to go well - until they are taken to a tattoo parlour

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mitch and Cam prepare to walk down the aisle, but are faced with a host of hitches before they tie the knot. Pepper is forced to bring the ceremony forward by four hours because of a spreading wildfire, while one of the grooms' tuxedos has been left at the dry cleaners

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Mitch and Cam's big day beset by one disaster after another, Pepper is forced to find a new venue - only for the couple to be forced out once again. Their only option is to hold the ceremony at home - but then Sal, who supposed to be marrying them, is forced to leave. Will they ever get to say 'I do'? Elizabeth Banks guest stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius is forced to help Georgie revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his brother's future on the football team. In doing so, he manages to pick up a few skills himself. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Montana Jordan

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope without him around any more. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is worried that people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Penny encourages Leonard to stand up for himself when he aims to become the principal investigator on a plasma physics study

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Barry Kripke finds proof that Dr Pemberton plagiarised his thesis in college, Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn their rival in or not. Howard is surprised but happy to learn that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at The Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him back in the day

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rayne calls in help from her followers and fellow influencers to make sure Juliet ticks off every item on her bucket list. Cindy worries that Zara may have a change of heart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is delighted that Leonard has finally managed to find a girlfriend who meets his high standards, but his over-exuberance looks set to cause problems. Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki star

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: When Jenna joins Adam for a nap on her break, Madison and Ciara pick up the slack in service, and Glenn takes notice. Chris gets injured handling a heavy water toy

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q try to get shoppers to repeat an odd catchphrase given by one of the others. The loser must participate in a drumline marching band

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Murr and Q work in pairs giving presentations about living life to its fullest, and pose as janitors giving responses to questions and statements over walkie-talkies

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts the show in which six potential dates bare all bit by bit in a bid to prove they are the one. She is joined by 28-year-old nature lover Oliver from Norwich, who has never had a girlfriend, and 48-year-old building boss Claire from Manchester. They will both choose a date after seeing what their potential partners have to offer on a purely physical level. But will they prove to be a good match?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose a date from six naked people. First up is 26-year-old Deanne from Somerset, who wants to find her perfect pub-going partner. But that's not all she is looking for - this is Naked Attraction after all. She is followed by 26-year-old horse lover Hezron from Coventry. Tired of fooling around with men who have girlfriends, he is looking for an out-and-proud stallion with whom he can ride off into the sunset

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Gemma's phone is stolen and Dave and Calvin team up to get it back, only to have their mission take an unexpected turn. Malcolm and Marty move into their new house.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave discovers Calvin has not seen a physician in nearly a decade and insists that he schedule a check-up

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Christmas has arrived, providing a typically chaotic time for the Pritchett-Dunphys, as Jay takes Manny to chop down a tree, Mitchell rushes to finish his shopping and Cam and Lily get into the holiday spirit at a charity event. Meanwhile, Gloria has a visit from her mum. Directed by Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston

programme.title: Lego Masters
programme.desc: Just five teams remain in the semi-final, and this week they're challenged to create a bust of a live model Johnny Vegas. Using the plastic building bricks, the teams must create a sculpture that not only looks like the funnyman, but also express his personality. And he'll be the one to judge who's captured him the best. Contestants must also create a playable, life-sized arcade game. Presenter Melvin Odoom and judges Matthew Ashton and Fran Scott will be testing each entry for actual playability

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Craig decides to plan an Oktoberfest-themed wedding, but his uncompromising fiancee Sofia dreams of a boho beach wedding day

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Miles tries to interfere in Yas's new relationship, and also gets involved in another budding romance between his best mate Temps and Imogen

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family

Husband-to-be Mitchell, on the other hand, can't make up his mind about his old college pal Wendy, who is now his new boss, and Phil wants to impress daughter Haley, who has agreed to accompany him to the annual real estate banquet

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A day at the museum proves to be anything but fun when Cam, Mitch and Manny realise they can't hold their own against brainbox Alex. Claire is less than enthusiastic when she and Gloria go shopping to buy a dress for Lily, while Jay imparts some manly pearls of wisdom to grandson Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. Phil spends most of his time with his magician heroes - neglecting Claire in the process - and Mitch runs into an ex-boyfriend he dumped by e-mail, although it all seems fine when he invites Mitch and Cam to his bachelor party

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jay's turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesn't like. Meanwhile, Phil and Gloria stop off at her old salon and get scissor-happy when a stylist fails to show up

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid (1994)
programme.desc: Wise karate mentor Mr Miyagi meets the orphaned teenage grand-daughter of a soldier who once saved his life. As well as guiding her through the trials of high school and her first romance, he takes her to a Zen monastery to hone her martial arts skills. Adventure sequel, starring Pat Morita, Hilary Swank, Michael Ironside and Constance Towers

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny finds out Leonard's family never celebrated his birthdays, so she enlists Sheldon's help to organise a surprise party, while Howard gets him out of the way by staging an emergency hospital visit. Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny's former boyfriend Zack and his wife encounter fertility problems when wanting a baby, so ask Leonard for his help. Raj attempts to patch things up with his estranged fiancee Anu

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct by two physicists from Chicago - until the experts try to exclude Amy from their Nobel Prize nomination. Bernadette experiences a big success at work and plans for Penny to become a part of it - whether she wants to or not

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is excited to help Howard and Bernadette navigate some bureaucratic paperwork, until he discovers that they are breaking the law, leaving him with a difficult choice between following the rules or staying loyal to his friends. Leonard is disappointed when he is excluded from a scientific project his friends are working on

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Kevin, 67, is in the drainage business and brings his unique blend of diamond in the rough and Essex boy charm to his date with receptionist Meguel

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard becomes convinced he has met his soulmate in the form of surgeon Stephanie Barnett, but he fails to realise she is far more interested in Leonard. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj argue about what to watch on TV. Sara Rue guest stars

programme.title: Little Fockers (2010)
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson hosts the full-frontal dating show, and first into the studio is 23-year-old trans woman Callie from Glasgow, who is looking for a man who is proud to have her on his arm. Next up is 24-year-old product design engineer Luca from Edinburgh, a part-time model who is hoping to find his perfect muse

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics check out The Wine Show, All Together Now, Troy: Fall of a City, Theresa May's appearance on This Morning, 24 Hours in Police Custody, 24 Hours in A&E, The Job Interview and the News. From February 2018

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their thoughts on Saturday Night Takeaway, Celebrity Haunted Mansion, Point Break, Britain's Brightest Family, Portrait Artist of the Year, Troy: Fall of a City and the News. From March 2018

programme.title: Gogglebox

From March 2018

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil, Jay and Luke wage war against three generations of Thorpes, including Phil's arch- rival Gil. programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton is on the Costa Calida in Spain, with Nadine, who is looking to permanently relocate to Spain with her husband Tyler. Nadine's best friend Jannette is coming on the search to offer a helping hand as shows the friends five properties within the budget of ¬£160,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A weaver in Portugal juggles teaching with preparing for her first exhibition, while in Andaluc√≠a, owners of a B&B establishment host a trial weekend to see whether they have a viable business. Reality series following Brits as they launch new businesses across France, Spain, Italy and Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head to Suffolk to meet Margaret, an avid collector who is also a former mayor, so they need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the relatives of a south London woman, but they are misled by a trail of dubious clues and are left questioning their knowledge. Meanwhile, research into family trees reveals the lives of British soldiers in 19th-century India

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Teacher Jeffrey Hancock always kept in touch with his relatives, but when the team takes on his case, the pressure is on to track them down. Meanwhile, research into family trees uncovers secret liaisons and the challenges of life as part of the Women's Royal Naval Service, before details of unclaimed estates are disclosed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Callum Hogg and Lauren Abraham's modern Park Hotel in Gloucestershire, where sisters Sue Lewis and Wendy Germann are impressed by the colourful decor, but it's not an opinion held by all. The guests are not impressed with having to pay extra for breakfast and Callum and Lauren are faced with robust feedback that leaves them wanting answers and thinking not everyone is being fair

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to Sue's B&B, which is run by Sue Lewis and her sister, Wendy Germann. Breakfast at the communal table has its awkward moments and Sue is under pressure, having never cooked for so many before. However, it's the feedback that leaves the hosts wondering if maybe some of the guests have not been that straightforward

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Talbot in Iwerne Minster, Dorset, for the third day of the competition, where hosts Erika Watt and Ellie Gill greet their guests. The rooms do not live up to their good first impression and Callum and Lauren are quick to find fault. At breakfast, tensions simmer as Wendy calls Cameron a creep, and at feedback, some of the comments send Erika and Ellie into fits of giggles

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit of the week is to The Old Rectory in Llangattock, south Wales, where young hotel manager Cameron Thomas likes to keep things professional. Despite wanting to find fault, Lauren and Callum are soon to admit their bridal suite is top notch, but Erika and Ellie think there may be some cleaning issues. During an afternoon of canoe racing the group members show their competitive sides

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Park Hotel in Gloucestershire is up first as owners Callum Hogg and Lauren Abraham want to get to the bottom of why Cameron didn't sleep soundly. Next, Sue Lewis from Sue's B&B seeks to discover the deasons for Callum and Lauren's low score for the cleanliness. When all issues are resolved, the winning establishment is revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree make plans to host weddings in the grounds of their property, while looking ahead to keeping livestock and growing their own crops. Dick takes steps to generate solar power during a hot summer, and turns an old oil tank into a pig roaster

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nervous young labrador Loki arrives at the centre, and soon meets seasoned dog owner Sharron, a Royal Navy nurse. But will a recent injury prevent her from taking him in? Small terrier Midnight is also looking for a forever home, although when he is introduced to a couple dealing with the pain of not being able to have children, he only has eyes for one of them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Product designer Rebecca Sturrock has returned to her family home in Cornwall with her partner Gregory Kewish and a highly ambitious plan. Together they hope to transform a small, damp bungalow into a cutting-edge home to share with their twin three-year-old daughters - all for just ¬£80,000. The design is radical - to reinforce the walls of the old property and add a new living space on top to take advantage of the views. This extra floor will be made entirely of thick wooden panels engineered in Germany and normally assembled by a crew of specialist installers. However, budget constraints mean the couple are determined to do it all themselves

programme.title: I Killed My Husband
programme.desc: Anna is increasingly overwhelmed by flashbacks and is coming closer and closer to disaster. Lucas wants Anna to see the truth about a case Manuel appeared to bungle. Caldera is worried she might be getting sidelined in the case. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Featuring people who have faced challenges and transformed their lives, including Nicole, who burnt her foot with caustic soda while cleaning her drains. Nicole reveals that she was born a man, and in 1979 was the lead singer of The Jags, whose song Back of My Hand was riding high in the charts. Cameras also focus on Francis, 28, who has fallen off his bike and is suffering from severe amnesia

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow 56-year-old Dave, who is brought to St George's after falling from a ladder at work. Doctors are concerned that he may have life-changing damage to his spine. Meanwhile, three-year-old Alf arrives in resus with his parents after being hit by a car

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Jayde Adams compete against Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson. David Baddiel joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David Mitchell take on guest captain Joe Wilkinson and Roisin Conaty. Tom Allen joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Featuring people who have faced challenges and transformed their lives, including Nicole, who burnt her foot with caustic soda while cleaning her drains. Nicole reveals that she was born a man, and in 1979 was the lead singer of The Jags, whose song Back of My Hand was riding high in the charts. Cameras also focus on Francis, 28, who has fallen off his bike and is suffering from severe amnesia

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Musical couple Paul and Judith Corazzo from Dorset have been dreaming of buying a holiday home in sunny Spain, where they can escape from their hectic work lives back in the UK. For their budget of ¬£140,000, Jasmine Harman shows them five properties to consider its La Marina Alta region

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads to Portugal to learn about the battle against the hidden nuisance that leads to corked wine, while in Cyprus, Matt Tebbutt solves the riddle of why cooking okra produces lots of slime. Plus, Kate Quilton looks into the surprising difference between runny and set honey

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Wendy and Chris from Surrey have been dreaming of owning a holiday home in Mojacar since they started holidaying there over a decade ago. They're now ready to buy, and cannot wait to start making more memories in Spain with their family and friends. Danni Menzies sets out to find them five properties to choose between within their budget of ¬£180,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karl and Naomh, who first met at university, love the relaxed lifestyle of Menorca and want to be near the beautiful beaches of its south-east coast where they held their wedding. With Scarlette Douglas on hand and a top cash budget of ¬£230,000, they are looking for a place with plenty of outside space for themselves and their two dogs

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the Home Counties with Harvie and Ranjit, who have had one of the longest searches she has ever tried to crack. With a staggering ¬£1.6m budget, it seems like it should be simple but the couple confess to having viewed and rejected nearly 100 properties. Phil Spencer has a challenge of a different sort. Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. They have their hearts set on the popular town of Hitchin and Phil thinks that might be partly why their ¬£380,000 remains unspent

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on carpenter Mike's 1980 Ford Escort RS2000. After his son's road accident, Mike's family want to repay his selfless devotion and give him the Car SOS treatment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dairy farmer's wife and Disney enthusiast Charlene Fry-Henderson hosts the first dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes that her locally reared meat, home cooking, and entertainment involving a plastic cow will secure her the ¬£1,000 prize. Her guests are local radio presenter Tommy Jardine, banker Olive Melville, prison custody officer Tammy Rice and trainee teacher Josh Jones

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast and banker Olive Melville hosts the second dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes to impress her guests with a crab starter and mousse dessert - but things take a turn for the worse when a conversation about the royal family divides the diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Local radio DJ Tommy Jardine hosts the third dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, and prepares chicken stuffed with haggis - but first he must continue a family tradition and rustle up a sheep for his entertainment. Tommy then tries to impress his guests with a touch of celebrity name-dropping, but young dance DJ and trainee teacher Josh trumps him at his own game

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher and club DJ Josh Jones hosts the fourth night in Dumfries and Galloway, and hopes he can broaden his fellow contestants' palates with his menu of Indian food. He plans lamb pasanda and tandoori monkfish, but Tammy Rice finds something in her glass that wasn't on the menu. However, Josh hopes his disco entertainment might impress the guests enough to bag him the ¬£1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tammy Rice hosts the final evening in Dumfries and Galloway, hoping to win the ¬£1,000 prize with her no-nonsense approach and traditional Scottish fare. The dinner-party novice rustles up chorizo and cous cous stuffed peppers for her starter and incorporates haggis into her chicken-based main course

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Shiralee Bed & Breakfast in Salisbury, run by Fay Lahiani and her partner Ray Cooper, where some guests are shocked by the colourful and cluttered decor, while the presence of CCTV cameras also causes concern

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At The Bluebell Woods in Northampton, David and Donna Bletsoe Brown try to bring a touch of class to their woodland B&B, but Fay Lahiani and Ray Cooper are on the warpath and are quick to discover a mucky mattress. Meanwhile, Marc Harris and Wayne Williams reveal their competitive streak during an afternoon of horse riding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lion Hotel in Pontypool for the third day of the contest, where manager Marc Harris and head chef Wayne Williams aim to deliver a high end service. Although some of the guests are impressed by the rooms, Ray and Fay find it too small for the price, and simmering tensions between some of the competitors leads to a clash over dinner. At breakfast, Wayne's food comes under fire, but it is David and Donna's feedback about finding a nail in their room that really rattles their hosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the B&B, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, with Fay and Ray from Shiralee B&B wanting to find out why David and Donna were so critical of their cleanliness. The group members continue to air their grievances as they find out what they've been paid, before the winner is revealed

programme.title: Great British Dog Walks with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: Phil is joined by Paralympic sprinter Libby Clegg and her guide dogs Hatti and Bramble. The pair walk with their pooches through the Yorkshire Dales while Libby shares her story and Phil learns how Hatti helps the Paralympian live fearlessly

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras reveal how individuals adapt and survive in the face of adversity. Subjects include Paul, 60, who is rushed to A&E after colliding with a van. Doctors are concerned that he may have serious injuries to his pelvis and spine. There's also a profile of four-year-old Jeremy, who is struggling to breathe. He suffers from a series of chronic conditions, including microcephaly and epilepsy

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at south-west London's St George's hospital on Harry and Meghan's wedding day in May 2018. As the happy couple tie the knot, patients and their relatives reflect on the meaning of lifelong love, devotion and commitment. Among those treated are David, 74, who is flown to St George's by air ambulance after falling from a ladder. Medics suspect internal bleeding and he is rushed to CT to assess the damage. His wife Lynda makes her way to the hospital as doctors try to prevent catastrophic blood loss

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Michelle Wolf take on guest captain Jonathan Ross with Johnny Vegas. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: The architect meets Tim, who plans to make a barn out of discarded windows and old driftwood, and novice builder Mandy, who is creating a retirement home in a minivan for her and her cat. Also, George and Will Hardie finally finish their Victorian-inspired observatory

They receive some bespoke and cutting-edge input from commercial and residential architect Greg Blee, with a plan that will link their home to the landscape beyond, including a Shard-like extension
