The only problem is, now they have no idea working out where everything should go and how to add style and proportion while sticking to their monochrome design throughout. Enter George Clarke to give them a few tips. The architect also pays a visit to a workshop where bespoke antique mirrors are made. But will he be able to achieve a distressed effect without getting too distressed himself?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Divorce lawyer Michelle Camacho hosts the first dinner party in south London, where she hopes that her 1970s menu of duck a l'orange and coleslaw, vegetables and a Bloody Mary sorbet for dessert will help to secure her the ¬£1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pub manager and artist Matt Wren hosts the second evening in south London, but his dinner party is beset by disasters in the kitchen and arguing guests at the dinner table when Michelle and Licia have a spat. However, one of the five takes a liking to another of the contestants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Licia Snow hosts the third party in south London, and hopes to impress her guests with rustic and homely touches during her laid-back evening. However, her relaxed and calm approach could be threatened when she clashes with Michelle at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Raphael Steele hosts the fourth night in south London and hopes that his first-ever dinner party will be a success. He plans a Caribbean evening based on old family recipes featuring ackee, saltfish and curried goat, and organises steel drum music for entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swedish businesswoman Charlotte Sundberg hosts the final party in south London. Her tactics are to present a night full of schnapps, folk songs and classic cuisine from her Scandinavian homeland, which she hopes will help her scoop the cash prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Canberra Guest House in Blackpool for the third day of the competition, where host Yvonne Copeland, joined by her part-time helper Gail Wells, hopes her cheap and cheerful B&B will win over her guests. However, Marie finds what she thinks is urine and hair on the toilet seat in her room, and a lack of wi-fi means Billy Junior has to put his business on hold. Yvonne takes her competitors to a local reptile house, but serious divisions unfold within the group, and later, tensions rise again at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Crown and Kitchen in East Linton, East Lothian, owned by father and son Billy and Billy Jr Robertson, who see themselves as the jokers of the pack. Yvonne and Gail leave no mattress unturned in their room inspection, although Michael and Carole are impressed. Later, Yvonne makes quite a splash when the hosts organise an assault course for their guests, but slow service during breakfast leaves the B&Bers disappointed - especially when Billy Jr is at a loss to explain what the problem was

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Dr George's truck accident victim needs two tourniquets above the knee to stop severe blood loss, but if they don't come off he'll lose his leg. Dr Mya's special brand of TLC helps a young woman who's in physical and emotional pain.

programme.desc: The heli-medics rush to help a man who has a single penetrating wound in his back, but who doesn't know if he's been shot or stabbed. programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor ends his journey by learning to drive a stunt car, sampling Hollywood luxury in an executive jet, cruising in a 1950s hot rod and taking an aerial tour

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: Rick's journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the area's famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the region's famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain. programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line
programme.desc: IPart one of two. James May, Kate Humble and Ant Anstead broadcast from inside Mini Plant Oxford, one of Britain's biggest and busiest car factories, where a new car drives off the production line every 68 seconds. James looks at the use of robotic technology and investigates the claim that British manufacturing is dead, while Ant explores the history and heritage of one of the most iconic cars ever built, and Kate reports on the use of electric cars in Norway

Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Northern Ireland across the water to Scotland. Leaving from the seaport of Larne, he reaches Stranraer and the Mull of Galloway, where in a lighthouse built by railway engineer Robert Stevenson he discovers a magnificent machine, installed at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A profile of some of the steeplejack's favourite Victorian engineers, reflecting his interest in their belief in the importance of hard work and enterprise. The documentary also highlights how Fred's idols eventually received greater recognition for their achievements

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Recalling the Bolton steeplejack's love of 19th-century life, which he said he wished he had lived through. The programme also looks at his admiration for great engineering and architecture, heading to locations such as Tower Bridge and Eastnor Castle

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide as he travels through Spain and Portugal. He begins in the city of La Coruna, where he examines the Celtic roots of the Galician people and tries to master the bagpipes, before meeting walkers from all over the world on the pilgrims' trail to Santiago de Compostela. Heading across the border to Porto, Michael finds out about the origins of Britain's long alliance with the Portuguese, and finishes his journey in the capital Lisbon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts his latest tour as Hampton Court Palace, where he is treated to a private tour of the Great Vine - the world's longest grapevine - before moving on to stately Claremont House, where tragic circumstances led directly to the birth of the Victorian era. He then moves up the line to Wimbledon and the site of a historic duelling event before ending his journey in Teddington, where he hears the story of a reformer whose work revolutionised the care for those with living disabilities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the final leg in Egham, Surrey, where a historic steam fair offers the original 'white-knuckle' ride. Across town lies the Royal Holloway College, now part of the University of London, where the ex-politician discovers the institution's philanthropic roots. Moving into Berkshire, Portillo drops in at a factory manufacturing a famous sleep-inducing beverage with historic roots. Michael's journey ends at Henley-on-Thames in Oxfordshire, where he learns that rowing in an eight is a challenging business

programme.desc: The start of the Easter timetable at the North Yorkshire Moors Railway finds marketing manager Laura devising a stunt to get some much-needed publicity. As the Tour de Yorkshire cycling race winds through the county, she plans to put one of their steam engines along the route to get the line some TV coverage. However, Piglet is tasked to fix an engine that Laura wants to be on display. Meanwhile, general manager Chris reveals how some of the bridges are in desperate need of repair - a ¬£5million project that the already cash-strapped railway will struggle to cover

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows America's iconic River Hudson, beginning at New York City's Penn Station, where he rides on the national rail carrier service, Amtrak. At Tarrytown, he hears a famous American ghost story, the Legend of Sleepy Hollow, and on the east bank of the Hudson he stops at Garrison, where he hears about the greatest turncoat in American history. In Poughkeepsie, the presenter visits a university built just for women, before arriving in New York's state capital, Albany, where he samples Albany Ale and meets the State Senator

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. programme.desc: A member of the public reports a car veering erratically across the M1 and Karl Jackson and Matt Cooling are sent to investigate. programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (2012)
programme.desc: Unassuming hobbit Bilbo Baggins is pulled out of his comfortable life when Gandalf the wizard volunteers him for a dangerous quest. He joins a party of dwarves who are on a mission to reclaim their lost homeland, which has been taken over by a dragon. When the group journeys into the Misty Mountains, Bilbo becomes separated from the dwarves and falls into a cave, where he finds himself confronted by Gollum and forced to play a riddle game. It is set in Middle-earth 60 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and is the first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott, Cate Blanchett, Ian Holm and Christopher Lee

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: The team investigate the disappearance of a factory's entire workforce - and how someone else has been using the facility as cover for a plot involving a nuclear power station

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Serving the Royals
programme.desc: Personal stories of the royal household's servants, including consultants, advisers and protectors of the House of Windsor

programme.title: Lilies of the Field (1963)
programme.desc: Travelling handyman Homer Smith stops at a remote farm in the Arizona desert to get water when his car overheats, and encounter a group of German, Austrian and Hungarian. He agrees to repair a roof for them, but the mother superior has a bigger task in store for him. starring an Oscar-winning Sidney Poitier, with Francesca Jarvis, Lisa Mann and Isa Crino

programme.title: Eagles Over London (1969)
programme.desc: A group of German saboteurs infiltrates the Dunkirk evacuation to enter the UK unnoticed and disrupt British air defences. During the Battle of Britain, a squad of soldiers is assigned the task of identifying the enemy agents and preventing them from changing the course of the conflict overhead. Second World War drama, starring Frederick Stafford and Van Johnson

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh joins Andre on a food adventure sourcing some of South Australia's finest produce. Back home, Poh creates two brilliant new recipes - the ultimate beef pie and coffee √©clairs

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: t's opening day at the Central Market Caf√© and Poh, Jono, Matt and Sara are nervous and excited

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims hatch a cunning plan to liberate the land of Codslow, ruled over by three evil immortals who depend on pearls, paper and wine to fuel their magical powers. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes on Mary's last day at work before her maternity leave when an old friend commits suicide - and she reluctantly decides to call off the wedding. Meanwhile, William plans the funeral of a kindly churchwarden, and is shocked to discover the deceased belonged to a society of cross-dressers. Martin Clunes and Julie Graham star

programme.title: Muck and Brass
programme.desc: Drama, starring Mel Smith as a property developer who manipulates and negotiates his way through local politics in a midlands town. Originally broadcast in 1982

programme.title: Song for a Raggy Boy (2003)
programme.desc: A widower is hired to teach at a strict Catholic reformatory school, but the harsh regime soon fires his anger, leading to a series of confrontations with the heavy-handed priests in charge of the establishment. Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Poor Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A young mother lives in squalor with her good-for-nothing husband. Kitchen-sink drama directed by Ken Loach, starring Carol White and Terence Stamp

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: Jason poses as a safecracker to investigate the bizarre case of a man who has been found dead wearing a spacesuit

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Cardigan Bay to Liverpool, visiting the heritage railway in Tywyn that was the inspiration for Thomas the Tank Engine and a community that is famous for knitting. She also paints a carriage in Boston Lodge, catches the famous Ffestiniog railway through Snowdonia, and visits Europe's fastest zip wire and largest pet cemetery

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Eunan O'Halpin investigates the struggle for Irish independence in the years after the end of the First World War, and the outbreak of civil war in 1922

programme.title: Planet Without Apes
programme.desc: Reporter Michel Abdollahi goes on a worldwide search to uncover illegal trade of great apes

programme.title: The Big Job (1965)
programme.desc: A trio of inept crooks try to retrieve a cache of stolen loot from its hiding place in the grounds of a police station. Crime comedy, starring Sid James and Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Paris Blues (1961)
programme.desc: Two talented blues musicians attempt to make their mark on the Parisian music scene - but complications get in the way as they encounter a bevy of beautiful fans. Romantic drama, starring Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Sidney Poitier and Louis Armstrong

programme.title: Sky Pirates (1976)
programme.desc: Two boys are befriended by an ex-pilot and his niece, who teach them how to fly radio-controlled planes. When crooks steal one of the aircraft in an attempt to smuggle a stolen diamond across the Channel, the children embark on an ingenious plan to thwart them using radio controlled Spitfires loaded with darts. Children's adventure, starring Adam Richens and Michael McVey

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of the disaster that befell United Airlines Flight 232, which was making its way from Denver to Chicago in 1989 when the DC-10 aircraft suffered a catastrophic failure to the tail-engine

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Orthodox (2015)
programme.desc: An Orthodox Jewish boy is bullied for his faith, and learns to box so he can fight back. When he pursues a career in the ring as an adult, it leaves him ostracised from his community. Desperate to support his family, he turns to crime, setting in motion a terrible chain of events that leave him more isolated than ever. Drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Smiley

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: London's Weekend

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert heads to the Yorkshire Dales to explore the limestone geology of the dramatic pavements, cliffs and caves as well as the wildlife dependent upon it. He meets Ingleborough National Nature Reserve warden Colin Newlands, who introduces him to the extraordinary plant life of Scar Close, and squeezes down a gully in search of the cave spider. Ray teams up with researchers from the University of Leeds to survey the bat population and spends time observing the dipper - a small river bird able to walk underwater

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Salisbury Plain in Wiltshire, home to Stonehenge and the largest army training area in the UK. He discovers an ancient invertebrate that depends on military manoeuvres to survive, and spots rare wildflowers in unlikely places as well as bird species, including the grey partridge, yellowhammer and corn bunting, that are in drastic decline elsewhere. Ray also meets David Waters, who has pioneered the reintroduction of the great bustard - the world's heaviest flying bird - after an absence of 180 years

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh joins Andre on a food adventure sourcing some of South Australia's finest produce. Back home, Poh creates two brilliant new recipes - the ultimate beef pie and coffee √©clairs

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: t's opening day at the Central Market Caf√© and Poh, Jono, Matt and Sara are nervous and excited

programme.title: Seize the Day (1986)
programme.desc: An honest salesman fallen on hard times return to his New York roots and a reunion with his estranged father. Drama, starring Robin Williams and Glenne Headly

programme.title: The Hasty Heart (1949)
programme.desc: A belligerent Scottish soldier is hospitalised in Burma and takes out his anger on a fellow patient, unaware he has only weeks to live. Drama, starring Richard Todd, Patricia Neal, Ronald Reagan, Orlando Martins and Anthony Nicholls

programme.title: This Is My Street (1964)
programme.desc: A bored housewife has an affair with her mother's lodger, but is driven to suicidal despair when he rejects her. Drama, starring Ian Hendry and June Ritchie

programme.title: Lost Lagoon (1957)
programme.desc: A man lost at sea in a tropical storm ends up stuck on a desert island with a strange woman, and decides to let the rest of the world think he is dead so they can start a new life together. However, his plans are jeopardised when an insurance investigator comes looking for him. Drama, starring Jeffrey Lynn and Leila Barry

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Moonbase is attacked by strong electric waves from a mysterious nearby planet, so the Alphans resolve to convince its residents they pose no threat. Sci-fi drama, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Nick Tate

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert takes a trip down the Wye, beginning in the Cambrian Mountains. He observes the mating behaviour of the sea lamprey and spots the varied birdlife along the river, including a colony of sand martins tending their young and all three species of British wagtail. He also meets Richard Davies, who has boosted water vole numbers in the area, and learns about Environment Agency scientist John Taylor's efforts to save the freshwater pearl mussel

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert is on the west coast of Scotland to explore one of the world's rarest habitats - temperate rainforest. He discovers the skittish sika deer and meets a lichenologist who shows him a wealth of species that thrive in Argyll's wet, humid climate. Ray also observes the nest of two ospreys and finds out why the reintroduction of the European beaver is benefiting other wildlife

programme.title: The Driver (1978)
programme.desc: A hard-bitten detective embroiled in a long-running investigation of a skilled criminal tries to outsmart the crook. Frustrated by his knack of fleeing the crime scene unscathed, the cop sets up a fake robbery in a bid to catch his man. Thriller, starring Ryan O'Neal, Bruce Dern, Isabelle Adjani, Ronee Blakley and Matt Clark

programme.title: The Maids (1975)
programme.desc: Two maids hate their employer, so whenever they are alone in the house, they indulge in a sexual roleplay fantasy in which they take turns dressing up as her, so the other can pretend to murder her. Drama based on Jean Genet's stage play, starring Glenda Jackson and Susannah York

programme.title: Song for a Raggy Boy (2003)
programme.desc: A widower is hired to teach at a strict Catholic reformatory school, but the harsh regime soon fires his anger, leading to a series of confrontations with the heavy-handed priests in charge of the establishment. Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset
